m_szDocTitle: Light Mix Today - Unprecedented Warming at the Top of the World? - StarTribune.com
m_szDocSumamry: Light Mix Today - Unprecedented Warming at the Top of the World? By                   Paul Douglas Purchase: Order Reprint Why We Call It Winter. Light Mix Today "No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn" wrote Hal Borland. According to the UK Met Office the word winters comes from the Germanic "wintar", which in turn is derived from the root wed, meaning 'wet' or water', signifying a wet season. Anglo Saxon ancestors measured the passage of time not in years, but winters. As in "How many winters have you survived?" Every winter is slightly different; the patterns are never identical.
